title: Killing of Alex Pretti by immigration agents fuels anger in traumatized Minneapolis
subhead: Two weeks after the death of Renee Good, Alex Pretti, a 37-year-old nurse, was killed during a confrontation between Border Patrol officers and residents in Minneapolis. Democrats are now threatening to block funding for the Department of Homeland Security, even if it means triggering another government shutdown.

title: Pressure on Trump intensifies after ICE kills a second US citizen
Russia steps up attacks on Ukraine's shipping routes in the Black Sea
Why the Israeli army doubts Hamas can be demilitarized
subhead: The second phase of Donald Trump's 'peace plan' for Gaza calls for the disarmament of the Islamist group. However, Israeli security leaders are convinced that it will continue to maneuver in order to maintain its capacity for both military and terrorist action.

title: 'The MAGA movement is divided in the face of Trump's openly imperial ambitions'
subhead: A significant segment of Donald Trump's supporters is in favor of isolationism. However, most of them would continue to follow the American president as long as he retains the backing of evangelical conservatives, political scientist Thomas Charrayre writes.

title: François Kollar shines a light on Parisian workers between the wars
subhead: A former metal turner at Renault, François Kollar became one of the leading photographers of the industrial world in interwar France. Between 1931 and 1934, he traveled across the country to capture employees and workers on the job. Several photographs from this series, taken in Paris, have been selected by the Musée Carnavalet for its exhibition dedicated to the people of the capital.

title: The dangerous liaisons of French rapper Koba LaD
subhead: At 25, Koba LaD, whose real name is Marcel Loutarila, is one of the leading names in French rap. He is suspected by the courts of having financially supported the escape of drug trafficker Mohamed Amra after his deadly prison break in May 2024. At the center of the investigation is the Black Manjak Family, a murky group formed around the artist.

Man charged with murder of young mother in southern France
France is considering banning phones in high schools. This school near Paris already does.
subhead: The Lycée Michelet, a large school complex with 2,300 students, banned mobile phones in its hallways in April 2025. School officials report positive results from a decision made in agreement with the entire educational community.

title: 'We were walking in blood': Iran's doctors recount crackdown on protesters
subhead: From crowded emergency rooms to apocalyptic scenes in Iranian cities, healthcare workers told Le Monde about the violence that descended on protesters calling for the end of the Iranian regime from January 8.

title: How surveillance companies track smartphone users through advertising data
subhead: Companies are offering law enforcement agencies the ability to track smartphone users through advertising data gathered on their devices. Le Monde attended confidential presentations of these new surveillance tools to learn more.

title: The EU's emancipation from the US requires clarity and resolve
A 'Board of Peace,' to do what?
'The success of books by French politicians like Sarkozy and Bardella creates a dilemma for booksellers'
